title: Understanding Irrational Numbers
topic_summary: An educational video explaining the concept of irrational numbers, their definition, examples, properties, and why they are important in mathematics. Covers the difference between rational and irrational numbers, famous examples like pi and e, and a proof that the square root of 2 is irrational.
target_audience: High school and college students studying algebra or pre-calculus who want to understand irrational numbers beyond just memorizing the definition.

scenes.title: Introduction to Numbers
scenes.narration_summary: Hook the audience with a question about numbers and introduce the difference between rational and irrational numbers.

scenes.title: What Are Irrational Numbers?
scenes.narration_summary: Define irrational numbers as real numbers that cannot be expressed as a ratio of two integers.

scenes.title: Famous Irrational Numbers
scenes.narration_summary: Present well-known irrational numbers like pi, e, and square roots of non-perfect squares.
risk_flags: Requires LaTeX rendering for mathematical symbols

scenes.title: Proof: Square Root of 2 is Irrational
scenes.narration_summary: Demonstrate a classic proof by contradiction showing that sqrt(2) cannot be written as a fraction.

scenes.title: Properties and Applications
scenes.narration_summary: Discuss properties of irrational numbers and their role in real analysis and geometry.

scenes.title: Recap and Importance
scenes.narration_summary: Summarize key points about irrational numbers and explain their significance in mathematics.
